meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: He thwacks the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: She thwacks the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The clown thwacks the balloon, making it pop loudly.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm thwacks the windows with raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The chef thwacks the garlic to crush it for the sauce.

meanings.sent1: The thwacks of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: He heard the thwacks of the tennis ball against the wall.
meanings.sent3: The thwacks of the woodpecker woke up the entire forest.
meanings.sent4: The thwacks of the waves against the shore were calming.
meanings.sent5: The thwacks of the hammer could be heard from the construction site.
